The past couple of years have been quite challenging for tourism because of
Covid restrictions. Now when people are willing to make up for the missed
travel opportunities, it is important not to miss your chance as a business to
gain new customers and return old ones.

Travel email marketing is a nice way to notify your customers about open
borders, interesting package deals, and new options for traveling inside your
country.

## What is the role of email marketing in the Tourism and Travel industry?

To provide your clients with the best service at all stages of cooperation,
from the subscription form to the thank you email. Communication via different
channels is the only way to sell such a high-priced product as a vacation
package in 2022 and 2023.

To see photos with smiles on your client’s faces when they are making it near
Times Square in NY or Basílica de la Sagrada Família in Barcelona, you have to
hold their hands from the first email till the time they make it to the
airport and even further.

(Source: Email from Gap 360)

### What exactly you can do with the right email marketing strategy:

  * start relations with appropriate and well-designed welcome emails to show benefits;

  * interest potential customers who subscribed to your news and updates and keep loyal ones who already purchased your service;

  * share valuable information on the upcoming trip, such as contact for emergencies, interesting sights to see, seasonal events, etc., to be a good assistant and retain customers;

  * give clients exclusive deals and flash sales by designing creative campaigns to help your tourism business;

  * share with potential customers feedback and user-generated content from your audience to show that they can trust you;

  * give an opportunity to easily find details on deal packages by adding links to relevant information in emails;

  * offer personalized emails based on email segmentation to encourage customer journey and boost sales.

Use other marketing moments you can think of to raise a number of new
customers and transform them into returning customers.

So, travel email marketing is a must today. And this is what we will talk
about in this article — all the best practices and examples of email marketing
campaigns.

## Tips on how to create powerful email campaigns for the travel and tourism
industry

### 1\. Stay brand consistent

Work with a neat and distinguishable brand identity. Use your brand colors,
logo, fonts, and visual elements so your new customers will get accustomed to
you faster and your old ones will remember all perks of your services.

Use this template

### 2\. Create a compelling subject line

One more crucial element of email marketing is a correct subject line. We've
prepared a few examples of such lines:

  * The ultimate Africa adventure guide — FlipBoard;

  * Travel essentials—pack less, do more — Patagonia;

  * Your last chance to book summer in California ☀️ — Outsite;

  * Your early-access invitation to Napa Valley is here — Aero;

  * Don't waste a moment this summer — Aero;

  * Labor Day staycay ⛱️ — HotelTonight;

  * Introducing Our Brand New Savings Pass! — Fort Myers;

  * 🏜 4 reasons to take the scenic route — Vacasa.

### 3\. Use different channels

Connect email marketing with social media channels by placing links to your
profiles in the email's footer, like in the example below.

## Types of marketing emails a travel industry needs today

### 1\. Subscription from

Of course, this is not an email. But how will people receive promo emails if
they do not sign up for your newsletter?

(Source: Travel Design USA, Inc.)

You can also offer bonuses for signing up for your emails. For example, you
can provide something like “Fill in the forms below and get a short-list of
the most available travel directions for now” or “Subscribe and receive a
check-list “How to travel 5 countries for $XXX in 5 days”.

(Source: Gap 360)

I guess you got what I mean. Motivate them with things they need.

### 2\. Welcome email

Not mentioning this type of email in travel email marketing is hard. After
greeting your subscribers, it is nice to share some information on the
benefits a person would get from being subscribed to you.

(Source: Email from Hipmunk)

In Travel agency welcome emails, you can ask them about their preferences.
Would they like to travel only by train or plane is preferable? What type of
rest do they prefer? Or what are their price limits? This information will
allow you to segment your contact list to make travel emails more personalized
and soothe communication.

Or you can do it in a promo email.

(Source: Hilton Honors)

#### Important:

After users connect with you via a subscription form and share their email
address with you, be sure to ask for their consent, meaning they need to
verify their email address and willingness to receive promo emails from you.
This is a very important thing to do, called Double Opt-in.

For more information on how to build subscription confirmation emails, please
refer to our “Subscription confirmation emails” blog post.

### 3\. Promo emails

Promo emails are the drivers of a travel email marketing strategy.

Use this template

“Make a Customer, Not a Sale,” said Katherine Barchetti, retail business
specialist. Understanding this quote is how to get successful sales and
increase your clients' LTV (Lifetime Value).

Let me show you a few of the best practices you can use to make your promo
emails competitive.

#### Tip 1. Share several offers and many photos at a time

You never know what the customers need right at the moment. Even if clients
tell you about their preferences, you must add a few other offers below the
one they prefer. In case they change their plans and wishes.

(Source: Email template from Stripo)

Use as many pictures as possible when you display one place from one offer.
Show the best of this location.

#### Tip 2. Remember about Seasonal email marketing

Send the emails related to dates, national holidays, cultural events, etc.;
add a promo code for loyal customers. This tip became a tool in the email
marketing travel industry.

People like to travel even for a few days to celebrate Valentine’s Day, New
Year, Christmas, Independence Day (or other important days in other
countries), and it is a nice time to use it for your advance.

(Source: Email from Universal Orlando Resort)

#### Tip 3. Use video in travel emails

Videos can be worth a thousand words.

Be sure to actively use them in your travel email marketing.

Use our prebuilt emails with saved slots for a video to engage customers

Use this template

#### Tip 4. Stick to Clarity

Try to keep it short when it comes to using words.

Picture — short description — price. Briefly written information with good
font and background + juicy pictures that cause emotions is everything you
need.

Your browser does not support HTML5 video tag.

(Source: Really Good Emails)

#### Important:

You can easily build interactive banners or AMP image carousels with Stripo.

#### Tip 5. Offer discounts on special occasions

Be sure to congratulate your customers on their birthdays. Tell them how many
places they have visited with your company and how many miles they have passed
with you. Or celebrate your anniversary, like a year from their first travel
with you.

Use this template to remind your clients how lucky they are to have you

Use this template

And offer a discount for the next trip.

#### Tip 6. Start sending your promo campaigns early

Of course, we remember about Last Minute Deals, but many people like planning
vacations in advance. You may help them out.

For example, if you want to sell the trip for May, it is better to begin the
campaign in Winter when people are thinking about how nice it would be to go
somewhere as soon as the warm days come.

At the same time, when the hot Summer ends, you can start on the Christmas
campaigns.

(Source: Email from Universal Orlando Resort, sent on Jun 18)

### 4\. Booking confirmation email

Always notify customers that you have processed their orders and that their
rooms/ tickets/ trips are saved.

Don’t make them nervous — send such emails immediately.

(Source: Really Good Emails)

Also, success lies in a follow-up email, like a reminder email with valuable
content for customers to refresh details.

### 5\. Abandoned cart email

Such emails are highly important for the email marketing travel industry.
Remind people about their wishes and choices.

People have different reasons or circumstances. They might have simply
forgotten to complete the checkout because of being interrupted and then lost
the booking page link.

They also can be caught by the competitors, and you have to remind them of the
advantages of your offer.

(Source: Really Good Emails)

Clients can doubt. Of course, it happens. In this way, you have to ensure that
your offer is the best choice with the best price and quality.

### 6\. Emails with bonuses for trips or Membership emails

Everyone likes bonuses, especially significant ones. Here are a few examples
of how you can give rewards and get benefits.

(Source: Hilton Honors)

This is a good way to make it possible for people to get something like a card
that collects vouchers, discounts, bonuses, and so on. Many airlines have a
bonus system where miles are accumulated, and customers can use that in the
future. You can come up with something similar using your imagination!

### 7\. Post-purchase emails

Communication with customers does not end with a purchase. Remember I wrote
that you must always hold your client's hand?

What does it mean from an email marketing perspective? Building post-purchase
campaigns.

#### What to include in such emails:

  * weather conditions and weather forecast for the town/country your clients are going to; 

  * local traditions that will help the clients not get into trouble there;

  * tell them what clothes will be suitable for that place; 

  * local events;

  * geolocation of the hotel your clients are staying in so they can easily find it;

  * sights of the country/city.

(Source: Really Good Emails)

### 8\. Survey invitation email

Always ask customers if they liked traveling with your company or enjoyed
their trip.

You need to know if your clients are satisfied with your services. It will
also help you pick more suitable tours for them.

#### Important:

If you allow your clients to leave comments directly in emails without leaving
them, you will get 520% more reviews. Proven!

### Frequently asked questions

How do I get started?

  

Sign up for free to start building email templates and checking out all of the
features that Stripo offers. You can use the FREE subscription plan as long as
you want or upgrade to any other plan for more opportunities anytime. No
credit card required.

What is included in the Free plan?

  

The Free plan is great if you want to build beautiful email templates and
don't plan to:

  * export emails to ESPs
  * invite colleagues to collaborate
  * preview how your email will render in email clients and on different devices
  * send test emails to any email address other than yours

The support chat also won`t be available, but you can email us if you have any
troubles. You`ll also have access to our template gallery, but Premium
templates won`t be included.

Could I make a payment by bank transfer?

  

Yes, but we do not offer monthly invoicing, this option available for annual
plans only. Contact us to set up payment by bank transfer.  
  
Please note that the provided invoice will be issued by STRIPO Inc. company
registered in the USA and it will include the payment details of the USA bank
where Stripo is serviced.

Will my subscription automatically renew?

  

Yes, it will be charged at the beginning of each billing period until you
cancel.

How can I cancel my subscription?

  

You can cancel your subscription at any time in your Billing menu. To perform
this action click the "delete" icon in the Active subscriptions table.  
  
After the subscription is canceled, you can use the selected plan for the end
of a paid period. When it's expired, your account will be automatically
downgraded to FREE and no new charges will be performed.  
  
All previously created templates and emails will be saved in your workspace
even after your subscription was canceled.

Are there any discounts?

  

With an annual subscription you get a 20% OFF compared to a monthly option.

What are the support team’s working hours?

  

We are available for support in the UTC+3 time zone from 8:30 till midnight
during business days.

How long can I use a FREE subscription?

  

The Free subscription plan never expires❤️. You can use your free account for
as long as it meets your needs.

What are the payment methods?

  

We accept all major credit cards and PayPal. You can also make a payment by a
bank transfer if you're on an annual plan.

Could I make a one-time payment?

  

Our subscriptions are billed on a recurring basis. If you want to pay just for
one month, be sure to cancel your subscription after the first payment is
received. You can easily do that in the Billing menu of your account.  
  
After the period expires, the Pricing plan of your account will be downgraded
to FREE automatically and no new charges will be performed.

How can I upgrade my subscription?

  

Find the Upgrade button in your account or contact our support team at
contact@stripo.email

What is the refund policy?

  

We can provide you with a refund if you did not use Stripo after the payment
has been performed (did not create email templates, exports and/or sent test
emails and so on). Just let us know within 30 days after the payment and we'll
issue you a full refund for a prepaid month.  
  
For more information read our Terms of Use.

We need to add more users to the Account. How will that work?

  

You have an opportunity to add and manage users to your account by giving them
permission to view or edit. This feature is available with MEDIUM (+ 2
people), PRO (+9 people) or PRIME (+99 people) subscription.  
  
If that is not enough you can add up to 100 extra users to your account. It
costs $7 per person / month.Please note that the user you want to add to your
account must be registered with Stripo.

Is my data secure?

  

Stripo cares deeply about data privacy and security. Our team strives to keep
our security practices industry-leading. Every year we successfully pass the
Security test by Bishop Fox and have a badge of an official tech partner of
Amazon.

##### Have any other questions?

If you have more questions on our pricing and plans, contact us so we can
help.
